content: amigurumi legend of zelda link pattern by roxanne wood this pattern is recommended for the beginning to intermediate crocheter with knowledge of color changing increasing and decreasing also basic sewing and embroidery skills are helpful the link is made in separate pieces which include body head arms hat and belt with eyes and hair embroidered on later supplies -one crochet hook us size g -dk to worsted weight yarn in the following colors green tan dark gold black and brown -stitch marker -yarn needle -poly stuffing abbreviations chain-chain st-stitch slip_stitch- slip_stitch single_crochet-single_crochet single_crochet decrease-single decrease worked over two stitches repeat -repeat the link measures about 5 tall each piece will begin in the same manner with a chain 2 followed by 5 single_crochet in the first chain each piece should be finished by making a slip_stitch into the next st to ensure a smooth finish we will begin with the body in the center of the bottom with green chain 2 round 1 in the first st work a total of 6 single_crochet 6 2 work 2 single_crochet in each st 12 3 2 single_crochet in next st 1 single_crochet* repeat from * 5 more times 18 4 2 single_crochet in next st 2 single_crochet* repeat from * 5 more times 24 5 2 single_crochet in next st 3 single_crochet* repeat from * 5 more times 30 6 2 single_crochet in next st 4 single_crochet* repeat from * 5 more times 36 7 in back loops only single_crochet decrease 4sc* repeat from * 5 more times 30 8-10 30 single_crochet 11 single_crochet decrease 3sc* repeat from * 5x more 24 12 24 single_crochet v 1 2 updated july 31 2011 www woollybytes com ©2007-2011 roxanne wood 13 single_crochet decrease 2 single_crochet* repeat from * 5x more 18 14 18 single_crochet 15 single_crochet decrease 1 single_crochet* repeat from * 5x more 12 16 12 single_crochet finish off weaving in end stuff firmly and perhaps add some sort of weight in the bottom before stuffing to help the little guy stand better head with tan rounds 1-5 work as for body 30 6-8 30 single_crochet 30 9 single_crochet decrease 3sc* repeat from * 5x more 24 10 24 single_crochet 24 11 single_crochet decrease 12x 12 finish off leaving a long tail for sewing head and body together stuff head firmly arms make 2 with tan begin with 6 single_crochet as established round 2 single_crochet 2 in each single_crochet of previous round 12 3 single_crochet decrease 6x 6 4 attaching green work 6 single_crochet 6 5 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet 2 single_crochet * repeat from * 2x 8 6 8 single_crochet 7 2 single_crochet in next single_crochet 3 single_crochet* repeat from * 2x 10 8-10 10 single_crochet finish off leaving a long tail for sewing to body stuff firmly now we will attach the body to head and then the arms to body in the appropriate places of course now for the hat and belt to prepare our little link for action
